Package com.RPG.Core

Class Backpack

java.lang.Object
com.RPG.Core.Item
com.RPG.Core.Backpack
public class Backpack extends Item
A class representing a BackPack Item
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ben Demets
Invariants:
backpack must have proper Items 
areProperItems()
capacity of a backpack must be bigger than zero 
isValidCapacity()
capacity of a backpack must be bigger than or equal to the combined weight of all its items 
canHoldItems()

  • Constructor Details

    • Backpack

      public Backpack(double weight, int Value, int Capacity, Entity Holder, AnchorPoint anchorPoint, ShineLevel shinelevel, ArrayList<Item> Content) throws InvalidHolderException, InvalidValueException, InvalidItemsException
      A constructor for a backpack with given weight, value, capacity, Holder, anchorpoint, shineLevel, Content
      Parameters:
      weight - the weight of the backpack
      Value - the value of the backpack
      Capacity - the capacity of this backpack
      Holder - the holder of this backpack
      anchorPoint - the anchorpoint this backpack attaches to
      shinelevel - the shineLevel of this backpack
      Content - the content of this backpack
      Throws:
      InvalidItemsException - gets thrown when items are invalid or cant be stored 
      !(canStoreAll(Content) || areProperItem(Content))
      Preconditions:
      All items must fit in backpack 
      canStoreAll(Content)
      All items must be not terminated 
      areProperItems(Content)
      Postconditions:
      Content of the backpack is set to Content 
      this.Content = Content
      Effects:
      creates a backpack using the auxilliary item constructor 
      item(weight, Value, shinelevel, ItemType.BACKPACK)

    • Backpack

      public Backpack(double weight, int Value, int Capacity, Entity Holder, AnchorPoint anchorPoint, ShineLevel shinelevel) throws InvalidValueException, InvalidHolderException
      A constructor for a backpack with given weight, value, capacity, Holder, anchorpoint, shineLevel
      Parameters:
      weight - the weight of the backpack
      Value - the value of the backpack
      Capacity - the capacity of this backpack
      Holder - the holder of this backpack
      anchorPoint - the anchorpoint this backpack attaches to
      shinelevel - the shineLevel of this backpack
      Effects:
      creates a backpack using an item constructor 
      Item(weight, Value, Holder, anchorPoint, shinelevel, ItemType.BACKPACK)

    • Backpack

      public Backpack(Entity Holder, AnchorPoint anchorPoint) throws InvalidValueException, InvalidHolderException
      A constructor for a backpack with a given Holder and anchorpoint
      Parameters:
      Holder - the holder of this backpack
      anchorPoint - the anchorpoint this backpack attaches to
      Effects:
      creates a backpack using a more advanced backpack constructor 
      this(defaultWeight, defaultValue, defaultCapacity, Holder, anchorPoint, ShineLevel.LOW)

    • getTotalWeight

      @Raw public double getTotalWeight()
      getter for the totalWeight of a backpack
      Overrides:
      getTotalWeight in class Item
      Returns:
      the weight of every item in the backpack combined plus the backpacks own weight 
      result == this.getWeight() + getContentWeight()

    • getContentWeight

      @Raw public double getContentWeight()
      getter for the weight of the content of a backpack
      Returns:
      the weight of every item in the backpack combined plus the backpacks own weight 
      TotalWeight == 0
for each item in Content
  TotalWeight += item.getWeight
result == TotalWeight

    • canHoldItems

      public boolean canHoldItems()
      checks if a backpack can store all its items
      Returns:
      true if it can store all its items, false otherwise 
      result == this.getTotalWeight() <= this.Capacity

    • storeItem

    • canAddItem

      public boolean canAddItem(Item item)
      checks if we can add a given item to the content of a backpack
      Parameters:
      item - the item we want to check
      Returns:
      true if The Holder of the backpack isn't terminated, backpack isn't terminated, item isn't terminated and if TotalWeight + item's weight is smaller than capacity, false otherwise 
      if (!(this.getTotalWeight() + item.getWeight() >= this.Capacity) || item.isTerminated() || this.isTerminated() || this.getHolder().isTerminated())
      result == false

    • areProperItems

      @Raw public boolean areProperItems(ArrayList<Item> content)
      checks if all item in the backpack belong the backpacks holder
      Returns:
      true if all items belong to the backpacks holder, false otherwise 
      for each item in content
      if (item.isTerminated())
          result == false
result == true

    • isValidCapacity

      @Raw public boolean isValidCapacity(int capacity)
      checks if the capacity of a backpack is bigger than zero
      Parameters:
      capacity - capacity that needs to be checked
      Returns:
      true if capacity is bigger than zero, false otherwise 
      result == capacity > 0

    • hasAsItem

      @Raw public boolean hasAsItem(Item item)
      checks whether a backpack contains a certain item
      Parameters:
      item - the item we are looking for
      Returns:
      true if item is in backpack, false otherwise 
      result == this.Content.contains(item)

    • canStoreAll

      @Raw public boolean canStoreAll(List<Item> items)
      checks if a backpack can store all items from an array
      Parameters:
      items - items we want to check if we can store
      Returns:
      true if we can store all items, false if not 
      if items == null OR items.isEmpty()
  return true
for each item in items
  totalWeight += item.getWeight
currentWeight = this.getTotalWeight()
result == (currentWeight + totalWeight) <= this.Capacity
